metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23963 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When sharing geolocation during an active WebRTC share, Firefox could have reset the webRTC sharing state in the user interface, leading to loss of control over the currently granted permission. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 85.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23963` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 85.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 85.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 85.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '85.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
